about_the_game:
Originally released in 1987, this classic platformer for home microcomputers from British developers Gremlin Graphics follows the continued misadventures of Monty Mole. Now, relive those days in this remastered emulated version. Included are both the ZX Spectrum and Amstrad CPC versions.

Gameplay

Monty, having recently escaped the law to the rocky island of Gibraltar, has now become the target of Intermole. His only hope: to trek across the whole of Europe collecting enough cash to buy the Greek island of Montos and live there in luxury. Platform across the various countries, collecting useful items and much-needed cash.


This enhanced version introduces a number of modern features to this retro classic, including:

  • Saving/loading the game at any point
  • Support for most modern game controllers
  • Full control remapping
  • Image scaling and smoothing options

name: Auf Wiedersehen Monty (CPC/Spectrum)
reviews:
“If you want a hugely challenging, addictive and entertaining platform game then, then Auf Wiedersehen Monty is the one for you.”
100% – Computer and Video Games (May 1987)

“Auf Wiedersehen? Or is this merely Au Revoir? Whichever the case, it's certainly not Bog Off, 'cos Gremlin has kept up the Monty tradition and put together a really top hole multiscreen platform game.”
90% – Your Sinclair (June 1987)
short_description: In this classic platformer from 1987, take on the role of noted small subterranean mammal criminal Monty Mole, fleeing across Europe from the forces of Intermole. Can you collect enough cash to buy an island paradise and live in luxury?
